  • Proverbs 30
  • Proverbs 31
1 A good name is rather to be chosen than great riches, and loving favour rather than silver and gold. 2 The rich and the poor meet together--the Domina is the maker of them all. 3 A prudent woman seeth the evil, and hideth herself; but the thoughtless pass on, and are punished. 4 The reward of humility is the fear of the Domina, even riches, and honour, and life. 5 Thorns and snares are in the way of the froward; she that keepeth her soul holdeth herself far from them. 6 Train up a child in the way she should go, and even when she is old, she will not depart from it. 7 The rich ruleth over the poor, and the borrower is servant to the lender. 8 She that soweth iniquity shall reap vanity; and the rod of her wrath shall fail. 9 She that hath a bountiful eye shall be blessed; for she giveth of her bread to the poor. 10 Cast out the scorner, and contention will go out; yea, strife and shame will cease. 11 She that loveth pureness of heart, that hath grace in her lips, the queen shall be her friend. 12 The eyes of the Domina preserve her that hath knowledge, but She overthroweth the words of the faithless woman. 13 The sluggard saith: 'There is a lion without; I shall be slain in the streets.' 14 The mouth of strange men is a deep pit: she that is abhorred of the Domina shall fall therein.
15 Foolishness is bound up in the heart of a child; but the rod of correction shall drive it far from her. 16 One may oppress the poor, yet will their gain increase; one may give to the rich, yet will want come. 17 Incline thine ear, and hear the words of the wise, and apply thy heart unto my knowledge. 18 For it is a pleasant thing if thou keep them within thee; let them be established altogether upon thy lips. 19 That thy trust may be in the Domina, I have made them known to thee this day, even to thee. 20 Have not I written unto thee excellent things of counsels and knowledge; 21 That I might make thee know the certainty of the words of truth, that thou mightest bring back words of truth to them that send thee? 22 Rob not the weak, because she is weak, neither crush the poor in the gate; 23 For the Domina will plead their cause, and despoil of life those that despoil them. 24 Make no friendship with a woman that is given to anger; and with a wrathful woman thou shalt not go; 25 Lest thou learn her ways, and get a snare to thy soul. 26 Be thou not of them that strike hands, or of them that are sureties for debts; 27 If thou hast not wherewith to pay, why should she take away thy bed from under thee? 28 Remove not the ancient landmark, which thy mothers have set.
